person.persName: Benjamin Grant Willis (Bracken County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, attorney. Bourbon County, Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Garrett Willis and Ann Moseby Grant Willis. Married to Clara J. Payne Willis on July 29, 1845. Father of Harry P. Willis, Benjamin P. Willis, Letitia Willis, Annie Willis, Clara Willis, and Charles Willis. Attended Indiana University at Bloomington, Indiana, from 1833 to 1836. Attended Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, from 1839 to 1840. Studied law under James M. Preston in Burlington, Kentucky, from 1840 to 1842. Admitted to the bar in 1842. Attorney in Burlington from 1842 to 1844. Attorney in Helena, Arkansas, from 1844 to 1848. Moved to Brookville, Kentucky, in 1848, and resumed the practice of law. Attorney in Bracken County in 1850. Judge of the Bracken County Court from 1851 to 1854. Member of the Democratic Party. Attorney in Bracken County in 1860.
